text: Psalm 18
Praise to God for His Deliverance
For the \add music\add* director. Of David, the servant of Yahweh,
who spoke to Yahweh the words of this song
⸤when⸥\f + \fr Ps 18 \ft Literally “on the day” \f* Yahweh delivered him from the hand of all his enemies,
and from the hand of Saul.\f + \fr Ps 18 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
And he said:
“I love you, O Yahweh, my strength.”
Yahweh \add is\add* my rock and my fortress and my deliverer,
my God, my rock in whom I have taken refuge,
my shield and the horn of my deliverance, my stronghold.
I called upon Yahweh, who is worthy to be praised,
and I was saved from my enemies.
The ropes of death encircled me,
and streams of ruin overwhelmed me.
The ropes of Sheol surrounded me;
\add the\add* snares of death confronted me.
In my trouble I called on Yahweh,
and to my God I cried for help.
He heard my voice from his temple,
and my cry for help
came up before his presence into his ears.
Then the earth shook and quaked,
and \add the\add* foundations of \add the\add* mountains trembled,
and they staggered because he was angry.
Smoke went forth from his nose,
and fire from his mouth consumed.
Burning coals blazed from him.
So he bowed \add the\add* heavens and came down
with a thick cloud under his feet.
And he mounted a cherub and flew,
and he swooped down on wings of wind.
He made darkness his hiding place;
all about him his covering
\add was\add* a darkness of waters, ⸤thick clouds⸥.\f + \fr 18:11 \ft Literally “clouds of clouds” \f*
From the brightness before him
his clouds passed over
\add with\add* hail and coals of fire.
And Yahweh thundered from the heavens,
and the Most High uttered his voice
\add with\add* hail and coals of fire.
And he shot his arrows and scattered them,\f + \fr 18:14 \ft That is, the enemy \f*
and many lightning bolts and routed them.
Then the channels of \add the\add* sea became visible,
and \add the\add* foundations of \add the\add* world were uncovered
by your rebuke, O Yahweh,
by the ⸤blast⸥\f + \fr 18:15 \ft Or “breath” \f* of the wind of your nose.
He reached\f + \fr 18:16 \ft Or “sent” \f* from on high; he seized me.
He drew me from many waters.
He delivered me from my strong enemy,
and from \add those who\add* hated me
because they were stronger than I.
They confronted me on the day of disaster,
but Yahweh was my support.
So he brought me out to a spacious place.
He delivered me because he delighted in me.
Yahweh has rewarded me according to my righteousness;
According to the cleanness of my hands
he has repaid me.
Because I have kept the ways of Yahweh,
and have not acted wickedly against my God,
because all his ordinances \add are\add* before me,
and his statutes I have not removed from me,
and I was blameless before him,
and I kept myself from my guilt.
Therefore Yahweh has repaid me according to my righteousness,
according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.
To \add the\add* loyal you show yourself loyal.
To \add the\add* blameless you show yourself blameless.
To \add the\add* pure you show yourself pure.
but to \add the\add* wicked you show yourself shrewd.
For you deliver humble people,
but haughty eyes you humiliate.
For you light my lamp;
Yahweh, my God, lights up my darkness.
For with you I can charge a troop,
and with my God I can scale a wall.
This\f + \fr 18:30 \ft Hebrew “The” \f* God—his way \add is\add* blameless.
The word of Yahweh \add is\add* flawless.\f + \fr 18:30 \ft Or “refined” \f*
He \add is\add* a shield for all those who take refuge in him.
For who \add is\add* God apart from Yahweh,
and who \add is\add* a rock except our God?
The God who girded me \add with\add* strength,
and made safe\f + \fr 18:32 \ft Or “blameless” \f* my way,
he made my feet like the deer’s,
and on my high places he makes me stand.
\add He\add* trains my hands for war,
so that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
You also gave me the shield of your salvation,
and your right hand supported me,
and your humility made me great.
You enlarged my step under me,
and my ankles did not slip.
I chased my enemies and overtook them;
I did not turn back until they were finished \add off\add*.
I struck them and they were not able to stand up;
they fell under my feet.
And you girded me \add with\add* strength for the battle;
\add those\add* rising against me you made to kneel under me.
And you ⸤made my enemies turn their backs⸥,\f + \fr 18:40 \ft Literally “turned to me my enemies’ neck” \f*
then I destroyed those \add who\add* hated me.
They cried out but there was no rescuer,
\add even\add* to Yahweh, but he did not answer them.
And I ground them like dust ⸤in the wind⸥,\f + \fr 18:42 \ft Literally “on \fq the \ft face of \fq the \ft wind” \f*
I emptied them\f + \fr 18:42 \ft Many Hebrew manuscripts, the LXX, Syriac, and \xt 2 Sam 22:43 \ft read “I crushed them” \f* out like mud of \add the\add* streets.
You rescued me from strife with people;
you set me as head (over) nations.
People I did not know served me;
as soon as ⸤they heard⸥,\f + \fr 18:44 \ft Literally “hearing of ear” \f* they obeyed me.
\add The\add* children of a foreign land feigned obedience before me.
\add The\add* children of a foreign land ⸤lost heart⸥,\f + \fr 18:45 \ft Literally “sunk down” \f*
and they came trembling from their strongholds.
Yahweh lives, and blessed \add be\add* my rock,
and may the God of my salvation be exalted—
the God who executed vengeance for me,
and subdued peoples under me,
who delivered me from my enemies.
Indeed, you exalted me higher than \add those who\add* rose against me.
You delivered me from the man of violence.
Therefore I will give thanks to you among the nations, O Yahweh,
and I will sing \add the praise\add* of your name:
the one who makes great victories for his king,
and \add who\add* shows loyal love for his anointed,
to David and to his descendants forever.
